revised_title: An Experimental Study of Turbulent Flow in Pipes of Rectangular Section
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the flow of water in pipes of rectangular section and found that the critical velocity for flow between flat plates occurs at a lower Reynolds number than in pipes of circular cross-section. They also discovered that the influence of disturbing factors, such as temperature variations, can affect the flow and that the region of the critical velocity is particularly unstable.
